workflow.name: Automatically detect & classify GitHub API errors with GPT-4o to Airtable, Notion & Slack
workflow.description:
Automatically detect, classify, and document GitHub API errors using AI.
This workflow connects GitHub, OpenAI (GPT-4o), Airtable, Notion, and Slack to build a real-time, searchable API error knowledge base â€” helping engineering and support teams respond faster, stay aligned, and maintain clean documentation. âš™ï¸ðŸ“˜ðŸ’¬

## ðŸš€ What This Template Does
1ï¸âƒ£ Triggers on new or updated GitHub issues (API-related). ðŸª
 2ï¸âƒ£ Extracts key fields (title, body, repo, and link). ðŸ“„
 3ï¸âƒ£ Classifies issues using OpenAI GPT-4o, identifying error type, category, root cause, and severity. ðŸ¤–
 4ï¸âƒ£ Validates & parses AI output into structured JSON format. âœ…
 5ï¸âƒ£ Creates or updates organized FAQ-style entries in Airtable for quick lookup. ðŸ—‚ï¸
 6ï¸âƒ£ Logs detailed entries into Notion, maintaining an ongoing issue knowledge base. ðŸ“˜
 7ï¸âƒ£ Notifies the right Slack team channel (DevOps, Backend, API, Support) with concise summaries. ðŸ’¬
 8ï¸âƒ£ Tracks & prevents duplicates, keeping your error catalog clean and auditable. ðŸ”„

## ðŸ’¡ Key Benefits
âœ… Converts unstructured GitHub issues into AI-analyzed documentation
 âœ… Centralizes API error intelligence across teams
 âœ… Reduces time-to-resolution for recurring issues
 âœ… Maintains synchronized records in Airtable & Notion
 âœ… Keeps DevOps and Support instantly informed through Slack alerts
 âœ… Fully automated, scalable, and low-cost using GPT-4o

## âš™ï¸ Features
- Real-time GitHub trigger for API or backend issues
- GPT-4o-based AI classification (error type, cause, severity, confidence)
- Smart duplicate prevention logic
- Bi-directional sync to Airtable + Notion
- Slack alerts with contextual AI insights
- Modular design â€” easy to extend with Jira, Teams, or email integrations

## ðŸ§° Requirements
- GitHub OAuth2 credentials
- OpenAI API key (GPT-4o recommended)
- Airtable Base & Table IDs (with fields like Error Code, Category, Severity, Root Cause)
- Notion integration with database access
- Slack Bot token with chat:write scope

## ðŸ‘¥ Target Audience
- Engineering & DevOps teams managing APIs
- Customer support & SRE teams maintaining FAQs
- Product managers tracking recurring API issues
- SaaS orgs automating documentation & error visibility

## ðŸªœ Step-by-Step Setup Instructions
1ï¸âƒ£ Connect your GitHub account and enable the â€œissuesâ€ webhook event.
 2ï¸âƒ£ Add OpenAI credentials (GPT-4o model for classification).
 3ï¸âƒ£ Create an Airtable base with fields: Error Code, Category, Root Cause, Severity, Confidence.
 4ï¸âƒ£ Configure your Notion database with matching schema and access.
 5ï¸âƒ£ Set up Slack credentials and choose your alert channels.
 6ï¸âƒ£ Test with a sample GitHub issue to validate AI classification.
 7ï¸âƒ£ Enable the workflow â€” enjoy continuous AI-powered issue documentation!

workflow.name: Build AI-Powered API Error Catalog from GitHub to Airtable, Notion & Slack

parameters.content:
## ðŸ§­ GitHub Issue Trigger  

Listens for new or updated issues marked â€œbugâ€ or â€œerror.â€  
Prepares clean JSON data (title, body, repo, timestamp) for AI processing.

## ðŸ¤– AI Classification & Parsing  

Analyzes the GitHub issue text using GPT-4o.  
Extracts error type, root cause, and severity, then formats structured results for Airtable, Notion, and Slack.

## âš™ï¸ Intelligent Routing  


Decides which team should handle the issue based on AI classification.  
Routes the data to DevOps, Backend, Support, or API branches automatically.

## ðŸ—‚ï¸ Database Logging  

Saves each analyzed error to Airtable and Notion for tracking and documentation.  
Maps standard fields like Error Code, Category, Severity, and Suggested Action.

options.systemMessage:
=You are an expert API error classification assistant for a SaaS engineering team.

Your responsibilities include:
1. Analyze GitHub issues related to API errors and exceptions.
2. Extract and identify error codes, messages, and endpoints.
3. Classify each error into one of the standard categories:
   - Authentication
   - Server Error
   - Rate Limit
   - Invalid Request
   - Database
   - Network
   - Configuration
   - Other
4. Determine the root cause based on error patterns and context.
5. Suggest a clear and actionable fix or next step.
6. Assign a confidence level for your analysis (high / medium / low).
7. Determine the severity level of the issue (critical / high / medium / low).
8. Map the issue to an existing internal FAQ topic if relevant.
9. Assign the responsible internal team based on the error category:
   - **Backend Team** â†’ Authentication, Database, Server Error
   - **DevOps Team** â†’ Infrastructure, Rate Limit, Network, Deployment
   - **API Team** â†’ Invalid Request, Configuration, Schema or Integration Issues
   - **Support Team** â†’ Other or unclear user-facing errors

Always respond in **valid JSON** following this exact schema:
{
  "errorCode": "",
  "category": "",
  "faqMatch": "",
  "rootCause": "",
  "suggestedAction": "",
  "confidence": "",
  "severity": "",
  "affectedEndpoint": "",
  "assignedTeam": ""
}

Be concise but thorough in your reasoning. Avoid non-JSON text or explanations outside the JSON.

parameters.jsonSchemaExample:
{
  "errorCode": "AUTH-401",
  "category": "Authentication",
  "faqMatch": "Token Expiry Issues",
  "rootCause": "Expired access token causing authorization failure on /api/v1/users",
  "suggestedAction": "Implement token refresh mechanism and validate expiration logic.",
  "confidence": "high",
  "severity": "medium",
  "affectedEndpoint": "/api/v1/users",
  "assignedTeam": "Backend Team"
}

nodes.name: Check: Valid AI Response or Data Missing

parameters.content:
## ðŸš¨ Error Handling 

 
Catches any workflow failure and posts an alert to Slack.  
Includes node name, error message, and timestamp for quick debugging.

## ðŸ§© Build AI-Powered API Error Catalog  
### How it works
This workflow automatically listens for new GitHub issues labeled as â€œbugâ€ or â€œerrorâ€, classifies them with OpenAI GPT-4o, and logs structured insights into Airtable, Notion, and Slack.  
It routes each issue to the correct internal team (DevOps, Backend, Support, or API) and provides an AI-suggested fix and FAQ match.

### Setup steps
1. Connect your **GitHub** account and select your repository.
2. Add your **OpenAI** credentials (GPT-4o or GPT-4o-mini).
3. Connect **Airtable** and create a table with matching field names.
4. Connect **Notion** and select your database (status, category, etc.).
5. Connect **Slack** and set your target channel IDs.
6. Run once manually to initialize webhook triggers.

## ðŸ’¬ Slack Alerts  
Sends team-specific alerts summarizing the error, category, and recommended fix.  
Helps each team act quickly on critical issues.

## ðŸ” Credentials & Security

  
- Use OAuth2 for GitHub and Slack.  
- API Keys for OpenAI, Airtable, and Notion.  
- Remove personal IDs or base URLs before publishing.  
- Test with dummy accounts before sharing the workflow.

main.node: Check: Valid AI Response or Data Missing

user.name: Rahul Joshi
user.bio: Rahul Joshi is a seasoned technology leader specializing in the n8n automation tool and AI-driven workflow automation. With deep expertise in building open-source workflow automation and self-hosted automation platforms, he helps organizations eliminate manual processes through intelligent n8n ai agent automation solutions.

data.details: In n8n, when a workflow execution fails, it can start another workflow. This second workflow can be any arbitrary workflow on your n8n instance. Use the Error Trigger node as your Trigger in the Error workflow.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
